0.title: FIR against ex-Kerala minister Saji Cherian over anti-Constitution remarks
0.article_body: An FIR was lodged on Thursday at Keezhvaipur Police Station against former Kerala Culture Minister Saji Cherian over anti-Constitution remarks. Cherian on Wednesday resigned from the state Cabinet amid protests over his remarks. The Constitution endorses exploitation and loot of common people, he had said. "The news that I criticised the Constitution is twisted," Cherian later said.

1.title: Mohammed Zubair approaches Supreme Court against UP Police FIR
1.article_body: Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair has moved the Supreme Court for quashing of a hate speech FIR registered against him in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur. He has also moved the court for pre-arrest bail. Zubair's lawyer Colin Gonsalves has approached the apex court against the Allahabad High Court's decision to not quash the FIR against him on June 13.

2.title: 5 pet puppies of 69-yr-old woman killed by poisoning in Mumbai
2.article_body: Five pet puppies belonging to a 69-year-old woman were allegedly killed by poisoning in Mumbai's Kandivali. The woman said that her puppies suddenly fell ill and died with foam and blood coming out of their mouths. She suspects that her 35-year-old neighbour, who frequently used to pick fights with her over the pets, might have killed the dogs.

3.title: Twitter should check tweets by perverted mentality people: MP minister
3.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra has said he will write to Twitter on tweets hurting religious sentiments, adding, "Twitter should check tweets posted by people having perverted mentality, like...'Kaali' film director, Leena Manimekalai." He will also write to the central government to issue a lookout circular against Manimekalai "as whatever she is doing appears to be deliberate".

4.title: Kohli not a certainty in India's T20I side: Wasim Jaffer
4.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Virat Kohli's form will be "taken into consideration" in the upcoming T20Is against England. "Kohli has not been in the best of forms...I don't think he'll be a certainty because so many young players have done so well," stated Jaffer. Kohli will be available for the second and third T20I against England.

5.title: My political tenure not yet completed: Naqvi after resigning as Union Minister
5.article_body: A day after resigning as the Union Cabinet Minister of Minority Affairs, Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Thursday said that his political and social tenure has not yet been completed. “I understand that my tenure in Rajya Sabha has been completed...I will continue to work with dedication and concern for society,” he added.

6.title: Siddaramaiah's govt was unresponsive to many scams: K'taka CM Bommai
6.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said the government led by Congress leader Siddaramaiah was unresponsive to many scams related to recruitment tests and PU (pre-university) exams. "It was a government that covered up many such scams," Bommai added. The scam related to PU exams, involving ₹18 crore, was buried without taking any action against the culprits, Bommai alleged.

7.title: BJP sending army of trolls to spread false info about SC judges: Cong
7.article_body: The Congress accused BJP of promoting personal attacks on Supreme Court judges and making campaigns to pressurise and influence free decision-making of the judiciary. "An army of trolls is sent out by BJP to fabricate and disseminate false information about the judges and altered photos are published to suggest a false closeness with Congress leaders," party spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi said.

8.title: Gita Gopinath becomes the only woman to feature on the wall of former IMF Chief Economists
8.article_body: Gita Gopinath, the First Deputy Managing Director at the IMF, has become the first woman whose portrait was featured on the wall of former Chief Economists of the IMF. "Breaking the trend...I joined the wall of former Chief Economists of the IMF," tweeted Gopinath sharing two photos. She served as the Chief Economist of the Fund from 2019 to 2022.

9.title: ALLEN sues 20 ex-educators for alleged breach of contract: Report
9.article_body: ALLEN Career Institute has sued 20 of its former educators for alleged breach of employee agreements, media reports said. The platform alleged that the teachers breached the service agreement by not serving a four-month notice period and not completing their service tenure. However, a Jaipur court dismissed plea against five educators who argued the clauses were against basic employees' rights.

10.title: Mentally unstable man beats 62-yr-old priest to death in Delhi
10.article_body: A mentally unstable man allegedly thrashed a 62-year-old priest to death in Delhi's Sonia Vihar, police said on Thursday. The accused, identified as Sonu Bhatt, was reportedly assaulted by locals following the incident and is currently in a hospital. After preliminary investigation, police found that Bhatt is not in a "healthy state of mind" and was known to the deceased.

11.title: Go now: New UK Finance Minister as he asks PM Johnson to resign
11.article_body: Britain's new Finance Minister Nadhim Zahawi has told Boris Johnson to resign, less than 48 hours after the PM promoted him to the job. "He is now undermining the incredible achievements of this government. The country deserves a government that is not only stable, but which acts with integrity," Zahawi said. Over 50 MPs have resigned form Johnson's government.

12.title: Actor Sreejith Ravi arrested for allegedly flashing his genitals at 2 minor girls
12.article_body: Actor Sreejith Ravi, who appears in Malayalam and Tamil films, has been arrested for allegedly flashing his genitals at two minor girls at a park in Ayyanthole in Kerala's Thrissur. The Thrissur West Police has registered a case under POCSO Act against him. Following the complaint by the girls, CCTV footage examined by the police confirmed the man was Sreejith.

13.title: Biden to revoke Afghanistan’s designation as major non-NATO ally
13.article_body: US President Joe Biden in a letter to Congress on Wednesday said that he intends to rescind the designation of Afghanistan as a major non-NATO ally. Afghanistan was given the status in 2012. The move comes after the Taliban took control of Afghanistan last year after the US withdrew its troops from the country following 20 years of war.

14.title: 'Kaali' director posts pic of people dressed as God, Goddess smoking amid poster issue
14.article_body: Amid controversy over the poster of her movie 'Kaali', director Leena Manimekalai posted a picture showing people dressed as God and Goddess smoking. Meanwhile, microblogging site Twitter has removed the July 2 tweet of the filmmaker which depicted an actress dressed as Goddess Kaali smoking.

15.title: Won't stop work on Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project: CM Ashok Gehlot
15.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said his government won't stop work on the Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project (ERCP). His comments came after Jal Shakti Ministry asked Rajasthan government to hold the project citing "lack of consent on interstate issues". "Water is [of] the state...the catchment area is ours...who're you to tell us to stop the project?" Gehlot further said.

16.title: Why not call 3rd one to shoot too: Big B on Ajay, Rohit's 'Bol Bachchan' pic
16.article_body: As 'Bol Bachchan' completed ten years, actor Ajay Devgn shared a picture of himself with filmmaker Rohit Shetty. Actor Amitabh Bachchan, who was seen in the film's title song, commented on the post saying, "Oh man, why won't you call the third one to shoot as well." The film also featured actor Abhishek Bachchan and actresses Asin and Prachi Desai.

17.title: EAM Jaishankar holds 1-hour meet with China's Foreign Minister on border issues in Bali
17.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi in Bali on the sidelines of G-20 Foreign Ministers' Meeting. Jaishankar tweeted, "Discussion lasted one hour. Focused on specific outstanding issues in our bilateral relationship pertaining to the border situation." The EAM added that they also discussed other matters including students and flights.

18.title: More than 50 Members of Parliament quit UK PM's government in less than 48 hours
18.article_body: More than 50 Members of Parliament have quit UK PM Boris Johnson's government in less than 48 hours. Johnson sacked Michael Gove from his cabinet post on Wednesday night after the leader told the PM to resign. Among those who have stepped down are Sajid Javid who was serving as Health Secretary and Finance Minister Rishi Sunak.

19.title: Fintech firms, NBFCs funded by Chinese money generated ₹950-cr slush funds in India: ED
19.article_body: Several fintech companies and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) backed by Chinese funds generated proceeds of crime worth nearly ₹950 crore by indulging in predatory lending activities and violating RBI guidelines in India, the ED said. The ED has mounted a crackdown on such companies who, it said, were "operating on the basis of instructions from Chinese, Hong Kong persons".

20.title: Pant has improved remarkably as a keeper like MS Dhoni did: Manjrekar
20.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said he was earlier sceptical about Rishabh Pant's ability as a keeper in English conditions, but termed his keeping during the Tests against England as "strikingly brilliant". "Pant has taken the job very seriously and his improvement has...been remarkable, just like [Dhoni's was]...The big news for India is the growth of Pant, the wicketkeeper," added Manjrekar.

21.title: Govt launches indigenously made motor & controller tech for e-rickshaws
21.article_body: The government has launched an indigenous, efficient, affordable and certified BLDC motor and smart controller technology for e-rickshaws developed by IIT Kharagpur. The technology was developed under the electronics and IT ministry's programme for the indigenous development of electric vehicle subsystems. It was transferred to Brushless Motor India for commercial production.

22.title: Bagga sends flowers to CM Mann on getting married, shares screenshot
22.article_body: BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga sent flower bouquet to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on his wedding. He posted the screenshot of his order worth ₹568 on his Twitter handle and wrote, "Sent flowers and Best wishes message to Bhagwant Mann ji on his wedding." Bagga had earlier criticised CM Mann for spending on advertisements of Punjab government's paperless budget.

23.title: Real consumers of Skin Foods Glow Mix feature with Malaika Arora: Kapiva
23.article_body: Kapiva's Glow Mix consumers Aishwarya & Krishna featured alongside Malaika on ELLE, showcasing their confidence from healthy glowing skin and emphasizing that skin needs inner nutrition beyond creams & serums. Malaika's secret for healthy skin is 10+ Ayurvedic herbs in Glow Mix that boost collagen production, naturally leading to healthy, glowing, clearer skin that boosts confidence, said Kapiva.

24.title: When you have big squad, it's difficult to determine the XI: Zaheer
24.article_body: Ahead of India's first T20I against England, ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan has said India should begin selecting players for the T20 World Cup in Australia later this year. "When you have such a big squad, it becomes difficult to determine which players should play," stated Zaheer. "The team [management] have to see what sort of combination they finalise," he added.

25.title: WHO calls emergency meeting as global monkeypox cases cross 6,000
25.article_body: The World Health Organization said that over 6,000 cases of monkeypox have now been reported from 58 countries, with over 80% of the cases in Europe. The agency will reconvene a meeting of the emergency committee "in the week of July 18 or sooner" to reassess whether the outbreak constitutes a public health emergency, WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said.

26.title: 66 Shiv Sena corporators from Thane join Maha CM Shinde's camp
26.article_body: As many as 66 Shiv Sena corporators from Thane, led by former mayor Naresh Muske, visited Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's official residence at Nandanvan and joined his camp. Former Amravati Lok Sabha MP, Anandrao Vithoba Adsul, also resigned as a Sena leader. Shiv Sena is currently divided into two camps, one led by Uddhav Thackeray and the other by Shinde.

27.title: They told me I needed to retire vs Fritz, don't know if I'll play semis: Nadal
27.article_body: Rafael Nadal has revealed that his team asked him to retire during his quarter-final win against Taylor Fritz due to his abdominal injury. "It's something that I hate to do. So, I just kept trying," he added. However, on being asked about his chances of playing the semi-final against Nick Kyrgios, Nadal said, "I can't give you a clear answer."

28.title: Murmu as President a matter of pride for country: Maha CM Eknath Shinde
28.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said tribal community member Droupadi Murmu's nomination for the Presidential election is a matter of pride for our country. "PM Modi has given an opportunity to Murmu to become the...President. It's a matter of pride and honour," he said. "I am also proud that a tribal community member has been nominated for the post," he added.

29.title: I worry for India, they don't have bowling options: Vaughan on T20 WC
29.article_body: Talking about the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said he is "worried" about India not having enough bowling options. "It is about trying to find players in the top five, who can offer you overs. Maybe Hardik Pandya bats in the top five," added Vaughan. "They have got to find a better mechanism," he stated.

30.title: Sky turns green in several US' cities after powerful storm, pics go viral
30.article_body: Sky over several cities in US' states of South Dakota, Nebraska and Iowa turned green following a powerful storm. The US' National Weather Service (NWS) said the storm was a derecho. It brought powerful winds, with speeds of around 159 kmph in some areas. "Have never seen something like that," a Twitter user wrote sharing a picture of green sky.

31.title: Twitter removes director Leena's Kaali poster tweet showing goddess smoking; she responds
31.article_body: Twitter has removed filmmaker Leena Manimekalai's 'Kaali' movie poster tweet which showed the goddess smoking. Manimekalai tweeted, "This is hilarious. Will Twitter India withhold the tweets of the 200000 hate mongers?! These lowlife trolls tweeted and spread the very same poster that they find objectionable." She added Kaali is the goddess of death and cannot be lynched, raped or destroyed.

32.title: Woman, 3 lawyers extort money after lodging fake rape case in Agra, arrested
32.article_body: Agra Police in UP arrested a woman and three lawyers allegedly involved in extorting money by lodging a fake rape case against a man. The woman alleged that she was raped by the man at a hotel. "The woman complainant and three lawyers were arrested along with cash of ₹3.75 lakh," an official said.

33.title: Over 90 ill due to diarrhoea outbreak in Lucknow
33.article_body: More than 90 people have fallen ill after a diarrhoea outbreak in Lucknow's Aliganj allegedly due to contaminated water supply in the area. While eight people have been admitted to hospital due to nausea and loose motions, a one-year-old child reportedly died due to the disease. "We took samples of...water...prima facie it appears to be contaminated," a medical officer said.

34.title: Level 2 fire breaks out in Mumbai supermarket, 12 fire tenders rushed
34.article_body: A level two fire broke out in Haiko Supermarket in Hiranandani Powai area of Mumbai. News agency ANI reported that 12 fire tenders were rushed to the spot. Reports also said that no one has been reported trapped in the building so far. No injuries or casualties have been reported.

35.title: Policeman removed from post over objectionable comments against UP CM
35.article_body: A station house officer (SHO) of Asandra Police Station in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki has been removed from his post for allegedly making objectionable comments against CM Yogi Adityanath. BJP district president Shashank Kushumesh received a video from a journalist wherein the SHO was purportedly making comments against CM Yogi while talking to someone in his office room.

36.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann gets married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur, first pic surfaces
36.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Thursday got married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur in a private ceremony, which was also attended by Delhi CM and AAP Convenor Arvind Kejriwal. Mann was earlier married to Inderpreet Kaur, with whom he got divorced in 2015. He has two children from his first marriage.

37.title: Islamic State claims responsibility for prison attack in Nigeria
37.article_body: Islamic State militant group has claimed responsibility for attacking a prison in Nigeria's capital Abuja on Tuesday. A total of 879 inmates had fled following the attack. Around 443 are still at large and the rest have been recaptured, the prison service said. Nigeria's President Muhammadu Buhari has questioned the prison's intelligence system and demanded a report on the attack.

38.title: CAs who helped Chinese nationals establish Vivo-linked firm under probe: Report
38.article_body: Indian agencies are now probing the local support that two Chinese nationals got in establishing a company which projected itself as a subsidiary of Vivo, The Economic Times reported citing sources. Two chartered accountants and a company secretary are under probe in the matter. Forged documents, certified by the three, were allegedly used to register Grand Prospect International Communication.

39.title: 12-year-old girl sexually harassed in Gurugram, accused arrested
39.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested in Gurugram for allegedly sexually harassing a 12-year-old girl. "Earlier, I took the matter to the panchayat where Sanjay (accused) was asked [not to do] such a thing again," the victim's father said. However, the accused harassed the girl again on Tuesday, her father claimed, following which he filed a complaint with the police.

40.title: Other Muslims are Assamese too: Assam CM on indigenous status to 5 Muslim communities
40.article_body: After Assam cabinet granted indigenous status to five Assamese-speaking Muslim communities, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said other Muslims are Assamese too and shouldn't worry. "They are Goria, Moriya, Deshi, Julah and Syed," state Health Minister Keshab Mahanta said earlier. This will ensure their development in health, education, skill development and women empowerment, Sarma said.

41.title: Over 44,000 challans issued under bus lane enforcement drive in Delhi
41.article_body: Delhi government's transport department has challaned a total of 44,594 people over the last two months under its bus lane enforcement drive. According to the department, till July 4, 1,591 bus drivers were challaned for lane violations, whereas 43,003 challans were issued to private vehicle owners for parking in bus lanes. The drive was launched on April 1 this year.

42.title: Man slits woman's throat for refusing sexual advances in Delhi
42.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly slit a 22-year-old woman's throat for refusing his sexual advances in Delhi's Gandhi Nagar area, police said. "Her 'mangal sutra' was found sunk on her throat and blood was oozing from there," police added. The accused, identified as Maan Singh, is a resident of Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi, police stated.

43.title: UK jeweller paid $7.5 mn ransom in Bitcoin to Russian hackers: Report
43.article_body: Luxury British jeweller Graff Diamonds paid $7.5 million ransom in Bitcoin to a group of Russian hackers after it leaked some of its customers' data and threatened to leak more, Bloomberg reported. Graff has now sued its insurance firm, alleging it has denied to pay for the losses incurred due to the extortion. The data leak happened in September 2021.

44.title: England are desperate for pacer who can bowl 95 mph like Umran: Gough
44.article_body: Former England pacer Darren Gough said England are desperate for a pacer who can bowl at a speed of 95 mph like India's Umran Malik. Gough added that Malik should be picked by India in their lineups for the upcoming T20I series against England. "We've got Mark Wood who is injured...we've got Archer who is [also] injured," stated Gough.

45.title: I attempted suicide when I was 21 or 22, jumped in Ganga river: Kailash Kher
45.article_body: Singer Kailash Kher revealed he attempted suicide when he was 21 or 22. "I felt I was useless to the world and not supposed to be born in this time and [plastic] world," he said. Kailash added, "I jumped in the Ganga river...someone saved me...At the time I thought I must be such a useless man...I even failed in this."

46.title: Actress Bevin Prince's husband William Friend dies at 33 after being struck by lightning
46.article_body: Actress Bevin Prince's husband William Friend passed away aged 33 after being struck by lightning on a boat near Masonboro Island in North Carolina in the US. Emergency responders tried to resuscitate him, but he was pronounced dead in the ambulance. William was the CEO of multi-platform digital media company Bisnow.

47.title: Zomato responds after pic shows price difference between Zomato online & offline bills
47.article_body: Zomato has responded after a LinkedIn user made a comparison of Zomato online and offline food bills of the same order. Zomato responded to the user saying it has no control over the prices set by its partner restaurants. "That said, we have conveyed your feedback to the restaurant partner and have requested them to look into this," Zomato added.

48.title: Not a bad option at all: Gavaskar on Pant as opener in white-ball cricket
48.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant can be "equally destructive" as an opener in white-ball cricket. "Not a bad option at all...[as opener] Pant will have a few deliveries to get used to the pace and movement...That can actually work in India's favour," explained Gavaskar. Pant scored a century and a fifty in Edgbaston Test.

49.title: Kejriwal wishes Mann on his marriage, says he is embarking on new journey
49.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal reached Punjab's Mohali on Thursday morning to take part in Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's wedding ceremony and congratulated Mann for his "new journey". "He is embarking on a new journey today, I wish him a happy married life," Kejriwal said. Mann will get married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur in a private ceremony in Chandigarh.

50.title: TMC's Mahua posts 'Be careful, Mahua!' poem by citizen after FIR over Goddess Kali remark
50.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra took to Twitter to share a poem 'Be careful, Mahua!' reportedly written for her by a citizen of India after FIRs were filed against her in West Bengal and Madhya Pradesh over her remarks on Goddess Kali. Moitra had said that Goddess Kali ate meat and accepted alcohol. TMC had condemned Moitra's remarks.

51.title: Sanjay said 'Tell me what to do', told me 'show me how to do scene': Karan
51.article_body: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra, while speaking about working with actor Sanjay Dutt again, said that he came to the set and said, "Tell me what to do." "I told him this is what scene is...Then he'd ask me, 'Show me how to do it once'. I would play whole part...and he would look at me with childlike excitement," he added.

52.title: Decomposed body of man found in apartment of Thane's housing society
52.article_body: The decomposed body of a 47-year-old man was found inside an apartment in a Thane-based housing society, the police said. The incident came to light after the neighbour of the man complained to local firemen about foul smell from the house. The firemen rushed to the spot and found the decomposed body of the man, Satishkumar Krishna Pillai, lying inside.

53.title: Chemist arrested for illegal sale of abortion kits in Gurugram
53.article_body: A chemist was arrested in Gurugram's Sohna on Tuesday for allegedly selling medical kits for abortion illegally. According to police, the accused identified as Nafiz was caught with five medical termination of pregnancy (MTP) kits. He would sell them without a bill and prescription. These kits were allegedly used to abort the female foetus in the region, police said.

54.title: LazyPay temporarily suspends 'Buy Now, Pay Later' service after RBI directive
54.article_body: PayU-owned startup LazyPay has temporarily suspended its 'Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL)' service named LazyPlus UPI. The suspension comes a month after RBI stated that non-bank wallets and pre-paid cards cannot extend credit lines via their products to customers. Through LazyPlus UPI, which was launched in 2020, the startup was offering a credit line of up to ₹1 lakh.

55.title: Hate cannot be countered through hate: Jamiat chief Mahmood Madani
55.article_body: Speaking about incidents of violence in the country following row over remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Muslim organisation Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind's chief Maulana Mahmood Asad Madani said that hate cannot be countered through hate. "The circumstances prevailing in the country, if it continues like this, then the loss will be of the country, not of any particular religion or community," he added.

56.title: Hyd civic body deploys 2,375 staffers to contain vector-borne diseases
56.article_body: In order to tackle the spread of vector-borne diseases, Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to deploy 2,375 of its staff members. GHMC has also allotted two portable fogging machines to every ward and two vehicle-mounted fogging machines to every circle. Notably, anti-larval operations are being carried out with 642 teams on a weekly basis in Hyderabad.

57.title: BMC to build 100 artificial lakes for Ganesh visarjan in Mumbai: Report
57.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is reportedly planning to build 100 artificial lakes across Mumbai for Ganesh visarjan. Officials of all 24 administrative wards have been asked to make arrangements for three to four lakes in each ward, reports added. This comes after BMC ordered citizens to immerse Ganesh idols made of Plaster of Paris (PoP) only in artificial lakes.

58.title: US July 4 parade gunman considered carrying out 2nd attack: Police
58.article_body: The 21-year-old man accused of opening fire on a US Independence Day parade and killing seven people admitted he considered attacking another July 4 event while on the run, police said. Indications are that Robert Crimo didn't carry out the attack because "he hadn't put enough...research into it", they added. Reportedly, he'd approximately 60 rounds of ammunition in his car.

59.title: Time will tell whether Edgbaston Test defeat will affect T20Is, ODIs: Rohit
59.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma, on being asked whether the Edgbaston Test defeat will have any impact on the white-ball series against England, said, "It's a different format and a different set of players who are going to take the field for us." He added, "England [are] also a different side...time will tell whether that result has impacted our preparation."

60.title: The manner in which India lost the 5th Test has to be a shock: Agarkar
60.article_body: Ajit Agarkar said England's win by seven wickets having been handed a 378-run target in the fifth Test against India, has to be a "shock" for the latter. Agarkar added India certainly had to make England work harder, adding they chased down the target quite easily. Both teams will face off in the first T20I of their three-match series today.

61.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's pic in his wedding attire shared by Raghav Chadha
61.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann's picture in his wedding attire was shared by AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Twitter. Earlier, Chadha had said, "Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal will be arriving shortly with his family. I have come here with my mother. I wholeheartedly congratulate Bhagwant Mann and his family." Mann will tie the knot with Dr Gurpreet Kaur today.

62.title: Govt releases 2nd list of 23 beneficiaries under PLI scheme for drones
62.article_body: The government has released the second provisional list of 23 beneficiaries under the PLI Scheme of Drones and Drone Components. This list included Adani-Elbit, Garuda Aerospace, Throttle Aerospace Systems and Absolute Composites, among others. The combined annual sales turnover of the listed companies has increased from ₹88 crore in FY 2020-21 to ₹319 crore (unaudited) in FY 2021-22.

63.title: FIR against AAP MLA for assaulting 2 men over sewage complaint
63.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Akhilesh Pati Tripathi was booked for allegedly assaulting two men in Delhi's Ashok Vihar area. One of the victims, Guddu Halwai, claimed that he met the AAP lawmaker during a function and complained about sewage problems in the area which angered the MLA who reportedly hit him on his head with a piece of brick.

64.title: Journalist says Raghav was thought as most eligible AAP bachelor, he replies
64.article_body: After a journalist tweeted that people thought Raghav Chadha was the most eligible bachelor in AAP ahead of Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's wedding, Chadha responded, saying, "The turn of the younger ones comes only after the elder." Chadha also wrote, "Best wishes to my vadde veer Mann Saab and Dr Gurpreet Kaur for a happy and blessed married life."

65.title: Idea of punishing a nuclear power like us poses threat to existence of humanity: Russia
65.article_body: The Deputy Chairman of the Russian Security Council, Dmitry Medvedev, has commented on attempts by the West to punish Russia for the war in Ukraine. Medvedev said, "The idea of punishing a country that has one of the largest nuclear potentials is absurd. And potentially poses a threat to the existence of humanity."

66.title: Jordanian Princess Iman gets engaged to New York-based financier Thermiotis, pic surfaces
66.article_body: Jordanian Princess Iman bint Abdullah II got engaged to New York-based financier Jameel Alexander Thermiotis on Tuesday. Princess Iman, who is 25 years old, is the eldest daughter of Queen Rania and King Abdullah II of Jordan. Meanwhile, Thermiotis was born in Venezuela's Caracas in 1994 and is of Greek descent.

67.title: Everything I tweet is my personal opinion, I don't have any other kind: Tharoor
67.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor said everything he tweets is his personal opinion. "I don't have any other kind," he tweeted. This comes after he said he was taken aback by "attack" on TMC's Mahua Moitra over her remark on goddess Kaali. Meanwhile, Congress' Ragini Nayak said, "Shashi Tharoorji expresses his personal opinions assertively and has done same on this issue too."

68.title: FIR against those sacrificing cattle for Bakri Eid: K'taka Minister
68.article_body: Karnataka Animal Husbandry Minister Prabhu Bhamla Chavan has urged people to not slaughter cattle for Bakri Eid  and warned stern action against offenders. "If cow slaughter is found, an FIR will be registered in the local police station...and strict action will be taken against the culprits," Chavan said. A task force has been appointed in Bengaluru to prevent cow slaughter.

69.title: Samsung Electronics forecasts highest Q2 operating profit since 2018
69.article_body: Samsung Electronics posted its preliminary earnings report for the second quarter on Thursday, forecasting highest Q2 operating profit since 2018. The South Korea-based company's profit in Q2 rose to around $10.73 billion, up from around $9.63 billion in the same quarter last year, as per estimates. Its sales rose to around $59.14 billion, the report estimated.

70.title: Pune man promised dating membership with 'sexual services', loses ₹18 lakh
70.article_body: A man, who was contacted by a woman, under pretext of offering him a "dating membership", which she claimed provided "sexual services by women", lost ₹18 lakh after he agreed to be a member. The woman allegedly asked the man to pay money for various purposes and also threatened to lodge a criminal case against him.

71.title: Red alert issued for several Maha areas amid heavy rains; Mumbai on orange alert
71.article_body: Amid heavy rains lashing Maharashtra, the India Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for Raigad, Ratnagiri, Kolhapur and Sindhudurg till July 9. Apart from that, Palghar, Pune and Satara are on red alert till July 8. News agency ANI reported that Mumbai and Thane are on orange alert till July 10.

72.title: I want us to play in same fashion, to be really aggressive: Buttler
72.article_body: England's newly appointed white-ball captain Jos Buttler has said their recent success in Test cricket is a reminder of the way they want to play cricket as well. "I want us to play in exactly the same fashion...really aggressive and not afraid of failure," he added. England will play three T20Is and as many ODIs against India.

73.title: Govt sets up panel to suggest testing SOPs for EV batteries: Report
73.article_body: The government has formed a panel which will formulate an SOP for testing and validation of key components and formulate a certification standard for EV batteries, The Indian Express reported citing an official. "The committee will suggest ways to ensure the right quality of the product," the official added. This comes amid several EV fires reported in the country.

74.title: 3 killed in landslide in K'taka; schools, colleges closed in 4 districts amid heavy rains
74.article_body: At least three persons were killed and one was severely injured in a landslide in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada amid heavy rains, police said. Following a red alert issued by IMD, authorities announced that Anganwadi schools and colleges will remain closed on Thursday in Udupi, Kodagu, Uttara Kannada and Hassan. Tourists and fishermen have been advised not to go to beaches.

75.title: Initially, Deepika's parents were completely thrown off by me: Ranveer
75.article_body: Ranveer Singh said his wife, actress Deepika Padukone's parents were initially "completely thrown off" by him. "Who's this, what's this? Especially Deepika's mom. She [didn't] know what to make of me," added Ranveer. "I have two wardrobes...When I go to Bangalore, there's a special wardrobe- white T-shirt and blue jeans. I don't want to throw (my in-laws) off," he stated.

76.title: Faridkot DSP arrested for accepting ₹10 lakh bribe from drugs supplier
76.article_body: Punjab Police arrested Faridkot Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP), Lakhbir Singh, for allegedly accepting a ₹10 lakh bribe from a drugs supplier for not naming him in the FIR. This comes after the supplier was arrested in Tarn Taran with 250 grams of opium and ₹1 lakh in cash. He was already wanted in an FIR from June, police said.

77.title: 9 new cases of BA.4, BA.5 detected in Maharashtra, all from Pune
77.article_body: Maharashtra has detected nine new cases of BA.5 and BA.4 sub-variants of Omicron strain of COVID-19, bringing the overall tally of BA.4 and BA.5 patients in the state to 73, the state health department said. All six patients of BA.5 and three of BA.4 were from Pune, it added. The city also reported 10 new cases of Omicron's BA.2.75 sub-variant.

78.title: 17-yr-old tries to loot jewellery shop taking advantage of heavy rain in Mumbai
78.article_body: A 17-year-old boy tried to loot a Vasai-based jewellery shop by climbing over the asbestos sheet of the shop amid heavy rain in Mumbai. Hearing the noise inside the shop, people gathered and thrashed the accused thief and later informed the shop owner. Taking advantage of the torrential downpour the thief made the attempt, Sub-Inspector Atul Nawale said.

79.title: HomeTown announces 'Mano Ya Na Mano’ sale with up to 50% off
79.article_body: HomeTown announced the 'Mano Ya Na Mano' sale with up to 50% off and 10% moneyback* on purchasing furniture, homeware and home interiors. You can take home leather recliner sofa sets, complete bedroom packages, homeware and much more at shockingly good deals, HomeTown said, adding that SBI Card holders will get extra 5% cashback*. Moneyback is valid till July 14.

80.title: Religious conversion of Hindus stopped: Goa CM on completing 100 days in office
80.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said religious conversions of Hindus in the state stopped within 100 days of his government assuming office. "Our government has taken a tough stance on religious conversion...Religious conversions happening for years have been stopped," he added. Furthermore, he said, "We formed SIT to look into illegal land acquisition matter."

81.title: Dhoni attends Nadal's Wimbledon match, celebrates birthday in London; pics surface
81.article_body: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni attended Rafael Nadal's quarter-final match at Wimbledon in London on Wednesday. He then went on to celebrate his 41st birthday in London. Pictures from his birthday celebration have surfaced online. Team India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant was also seen in attendance during Dhoni's birthday celebrations.

82.title: Dad's cooler, fitter than me: Hrithik on dad Rakesh Roshan's workout video
82.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Instagram to share a video clip of his father Rakesh Roshan working out. "Goals!" the actor wrote. He also used hashtags that said that his dad is cooler and fitter than him. Several celebrities including Farhan Akhtar, Priyank Sharma and Kunal Kapoor reacted to Hrithik's post.

83.title: I struggled initially, but recovery from COVID-19 has been good: Rohit
83.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma, who had missed the Edgbaston Test after testing positive for COVID-19, has said his recovery from the virus has been good and he's feeling nice and healthy. "I resumed training three days ago, and decided to play [first T20I against England]," stated Rohit. "There are no symptoms [now]. I've tested negative two-three times," he added.

84.title: Supporting DOGE wherever possible: Musk on Boring Company accepting DOGE
84.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk, in response to a report saying his firm The Boring Company will accept Dogecoin as payment for rides on its Las Vegas transit system 'Loop', said, "Supporting DOGE wherever possible." Rides are currently free on Loop but the firm reportedly plans to charge eventually. Single rides will cost $1.50, while day passes will cost $2.50.

85.title: Kamal Nath threatened police, administration during his term: MP CM
85.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Wednesday said former CM Kamal Nath used to threaten police and administration during his term and continues to do so. "They've understood that Congress...lost badly and...the defeat has to be blamed on someone," Chouhan added. His comments came after Kamal Nath accused BJP of using police, money and administration for civic polls.

86.title: Moon brought humans together in 1969, Mars can do that in future: Musk
86.article_body: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to say, "Moon brought us [humans] together in 1969, Mars can do that in the future." He also said humanity will "fight itself" without a common goal. "Humanity will reach Mars in your lifetime," he added. Responding to his tweets a Twitter user said, "I don't believe in the moon landing."

87.title: India reports 18,930 new COVID-19 cases, 35 deaths; active cases rise to 1,19,457
87.article_body: India has reported 18,930 COVID-19 cases, 14,650 recoveries and 35 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,159 cases and 28 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,19,457, while the death toll reached 5,25,305.

88.title: What is Apple's new 'Lockdown Mode' for its devices?
88.article_body: Apple's new "Lockdown Mode", which will be coming this fall with iOS 16, iPadOS 16, and macOS Ventura, is an "extreme, optional protection for users who face grave, targeted threats to their digital security". "It will help protect users who may be personally targeted by some of the most sophisticated digital threats, such as...state-sponsored mercenary spyware," Apple said.

89.title: Nobody imagined 'Tu Cheez...' will change everything for Akshay: Boxwala
89.article_body: Producer Shabbir Boxwala said nobody had imagined in their "wildest dreams" that the song 'Tu Cheez Badi Hai Mast' from 1994 film 'Mohra' will change everything for Akshay Kumar. Boxwala, who was the film's production designer, said, "We offered Mohra to Sridevi...However, we didn't have big male stars. Akshay and Suniel [weren't] known...Any heroine would think twice before saying yes."

90.title: Mentally challenged man climbs electric tower in Mumbai; rescued
90.article_body: A 35-year-old mentally challenged man was rescued after he climbed an electric tower near Kasara railway station in Mumbai twice on Wednesday. "He was merely smiling and waving and didn't speak a word...We offered him tea...biscuits and tried to convince him to come down," one of the rescuers said. "The tower is near a high-tension wire," an officer said.

91.title: IAS officer who got 44.8% in Class 10 shares his marksheet
91.article_body: IAS Awanish Sharan, who scored 44.8% in Class 10, has shared his marksheet on Twitter. Reacting to his post, a Twitter user wrote, "I left preparation thinking that UPSC considers only toppers. But you changed my perception today." "You have no idea sir how much you motivate youths like me that nothing is impossible," another user tweeted.

92.title: File your FIRs, will see you in every court in land: Mahua on her remark
92.article_body: Following her remark on goddess Kaali, TMC's Mahua Moitra said, "I do not want to live in an India where BJP's monolithic, patriarchal [and] brahminical view of Hinduism will prevail and rest of us will tiptoe around religion." Furthermore, she tweeted, "I'll defend this till I die. File your FIRs - will see you in every court in land."

93.title: Did backflip, SRK's car stopped in lobby, he said 'You were good': Vidyut
93.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal said that he once did a backflip on ramp during his modelling days. "Shah Rukh sir was in attendance. After the fashion show, we models were waiting in the lobby. And there is this fancy car that comes with silver glasses...car stopped...window goes down and he [Shah Rukh Khan] says, 'Vidyut, you were good'," he added.

94.title: Nadal registers 5-set win over Fritz, reaches his 8th Wimbledon semi-final
94.article_body: Rafael Nadal defeated Taylor Fritz to reach the Wimbledon semi-finals for the eighth time. Nadal lost the first set and took a medical time-out in the second but won the match 3-6, 7-5, 3-6, 7-5, 7-6 (10-4) in four hours and 21 minutes. He will now face Nick Kyrgios, who has reached a Grand Slam semi-final for the first time.

95.title: B'luru ranked 146th on Global Liveability Index, least among Indian cities
95.article_body: Bengaluru has been ranked 146th on the Global Liveability Index 2022 which was released recently by the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU). The EIU ranked 173 cities across the world which included five Indian cities - Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Ahmedabad, and Bengaluru. Bengaluru scored the least out of the five Indian cities with a score of 54.4 out of 100.

96.title: IMD predicts light to moderate rainfall in Hyderabad on Thursday
96.article_body: Hyderabad will witness light to moderate rainfall on Thursday, India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted. Telangana will likely witness heavy to very heavy rainfall in the next few days, it added. "The districts in southern Telangana are expected to receive heavy to very heavy rainfall...central parts can also experience good rainfall in the next five days," an IMD scientist said.

97.title: I am 'really upset' about my prop status as an actor: Karan Johar
97.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said he's "really upset" about his "prop status" as an actor, having not been offered any role after Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Bombay Velvet'. "If given an opportunity...I might be good," added Karan. Discussing the worst criticism for his hosting skills, Karan stated that he received it from Jaya Bachchan who said he speaks "too loudly" on the stage.

98.title: FTX has "a few billion" to help struggling crypto firms: Billionaire CEO
98.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX's billionaire CEO Sam Bankman-Fried has said the platform still has "a few billion" on hand to support struggling firms that could further destabilise the crypto industry. "We're starting to get a few more companies reaching out to us," Bankman-Fried said. His firms have recently helped platforms like crypto lenders Voyager Digital and BlockFi.

99.title: Pune 6-yr-old out with mom to get vehicle washed dies as grinder falls on him
99.article_body: A 6-year-old boy died after a grinder machine fell on his head at a workshop when he was out with his mother to get their vehicle washed in Pune. "We have not taken...statement of family members, once they register the FIR we will take further steps," police said. Reports said he was rushed to the hospital but was declared dead.

100.title: 4 held for stealing cash & jewellery worth ₹3 cr from shop in B'luru
100.article_body: Four people from Rajasthan's Chittorgarh were arrested on Wednesday for allegedly stealing cash and jewellery worth around ₹3 crore from a showroom in Bengaluru. "The accused had robbed Ramdev Bankers and Jewellers showroom...at gunpoint," Udaipur SP Vikas Sharma said, adding, "The accused were...handed over to Bengaluru police.'' The robbed items were recovered from accused after a police chase.

101.title: 12 buildings in Kurla to be torn down to avoid collapses: BMC
101.article_body: BMC has decided to bring down all dilapidated buildings in Kurla to avert collapses. Accordingly, it has identified 12 such private buildings categorised as C-1 structures, meaning they are dangerous to inhabit and started issuing notices to occupants to vacate them at the earliest. The decision came after a four-storeyed residential building in Kurla collapsed last week, killing 19 people.

102.title: Lady constable helps woman deliver baby at railway station in Thane
102.article_body: A lady constable of Railway Protection Force (RPF) helped a 30-year-old woman from Thane's Titwala deliver a baby girl at Diva railway station on Wednesday morning. The woman had reportedly fainted at the station following which lady constable Mamta Dangi helped her to a safer spot. Dangi then created a makeshift cloth curtain to help the woman with her delivery.

103.title: 3 stabbed in Karnataka's Kerur, large gatherings banned till Friday
103.article_body: At least three people were stabbed in clashes that broke out between members of two groups on Wednesday in Kerur in Karnataka's Bagalkote. This comes after members of each side accused the other of harassing women. Large gatherings have been banned till Friday as a precautionary measure, police said. Schools and colleges will remain closed on Thursday, police added.

104.title: IAS officer shares pic of MS Dhoni, says 'Why Dhoni is loved'
104.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan took to Twitter on Wednesday to share a picture of former Team India captain MS Dhoni and wrote, "Why Dhoni is loved." In the picture, MS Dhoni can be seen taking a selfie with two female fans. "Dhoni is real inspiration," a fan commented. Dhoni on Thursday turned 41 years old.

105.title: Professor in Bihar returns 33-month salary of ₹24 lakh over students not attending classes
105.article_body: Lallan Kumar, an assistant professor at Nitishwar College in Bihar’s Muzaffarpur, returned his 33-month salary of ₹24 lakh due to students not attending classes. "My conscience doesn't allow...If I take a salary without teaching...it'd be academic death for me," he said. "It's not just absenteeism...but...pressure tactic to get a transfer to postgraduate department," principal Manoj Kumar said.

106.title: FBI, MI5 chiefs warn of threat from China at rare joint address in London
106.article_body: The US' FBI Director Christopher Wray and the UK's MI5 Director General Ken McCallum have cautioned business leaders against threat from the Chinese government, in an unprecedented joint address in London. "We consistently see that it's the Chinese government that poses the biggest long-term threat to our economic and national security...along with our allies in Europe and elsewhere," Wray said.

107.title: Jaya said 'You have a mic, why are you shouting': Karan on hosting criticism
107.article_body: While talking about criticism he has received for his hosting skills, filmmaker Karan Johar said actress Jaya Bachchan asked him why was he shouting when he had mic. "I was like, 'I am trying to be energetic'. She said, 'You have a mic and that's what it is for, you don't need to scream when you are speaking'," he added.

108.title: Elon Musk welcomed twins with one of his top executives last year: Report
108.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk welcomed twins with Shivon Zilis, a top executive at his brain-chip startup Neuralink, in November of 2021, Business Insider reported on Wednesday. In April, Musk and Zilis reportedly filed a petition to change the name of the twins to "have their father's last name" and contain their mother's last name as part of their middle name.

109.title: Who is 1993-born Dr Gurpreet Kaur, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's bride?
109.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's bride Dr Gurpreet Kaur was born in 1993 and she hails from a village in Pehowa area of Haryana's Kurukshetra district. She completed her MBBS with a gold medal from Maharishi Markandeshwar University at Mullana in Haryana in 2018. Her father is a farmer, while her mother is a homemaker. She has two elder sisters.

110.title: 25 MCD schools to be upgraded as pilot project: Delhi LG
110.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has said that 25 Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) schools will be upgraded as a pilot project in order to improve teaching, technology and physical infrastructure in civic body-run schools. "Work will be started there at the earliest. The same would gradually be undertaken in all other remaining schools run by MCD," Saxena added.

111.title: Microsoft's $68.7 bn Activision deal faces competition probe in UK
111.article_body: The UK's competition watchdog CMA has opened a probe into Microsoft's $68.7 billion deal to acquire 'Call of Duty' maker Activision Blizzard. The CMA has set a deadline of September 1 for its initial decision. It'll assess whether the deal would reduce competition. Microsoft has said it's "appropriate for regulators to take a close look at this acquisition".

112.title: Pune to have no cuts in water supply between July 8 and 11
112.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will restore normal water supply to the city's residents from July 8 to July 11 on account of Ashadi Ekadashi and Bakri Eid celebrations on Sunday. PMC will take further decisions on water management after reviewing the situation on July 11. PMC had adopted a 30% water cut by announcing water supply on alternate days.

113.title: Netanyahu received gifts from billionaire: Witness in corruption trial
113.article_body: Ex-Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu had received gifts of champagne, cigars and jewellery from billionaire Arnon Milchan, according to a witness in the corruption trial against Netanyahu. The trial is addressing allegations that while in office, Netanyahu had accepted gifts worth hundreds of thousands of dollars from Milchan and billionaire James Packer. Netanyahu is facing two more corruption cases.

114.title: You have to go 'all in' to be a successful entrepreneur: Anupam Mittal
114.article_body: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal shared a clip on LinkedIn from an interview about his journey as an entrepreneur. Alongside, he wrote, "Money managers think the way to create wealth is to spread your risk...but ask any successful entrepreneur...you'll find that they've gone 'all in'." He added, "Ultimately...it depends on...how much risk allows you to sleep well at night."

115.title: MyGlamm parent The Good Glamm Group to open international division
115.article_body: Beauty firm MyGlamm's parent company The Good Glamm Group has decided to open an international division, as per a statement. The group further said it will consolidate its group companies into independent divisions- brands, media and creators. Last year, The Good Glamm Group acquired content brands such as ScoopWhoop, Miss Malini, The Moms Co among others.

116.title: Google launches Startup School India to enable 10,000 startups
116.article_body: Google India has launched Startup School to enable 10,000 startups in tier II and III cities across the country. With this programme, they aim to provide startup owners with resources and information to expand their business through guided online training. The virtual programme will offer fireside conversations with Google leaders and partners in the startup ecosystem.

117.title: Oil prices drop to 12-week low amid recession, COVID-19 fears
117.article_body: Oil prices on Wednesday dropped to a 12-week low amid fears of a possible global recession and demand cut in China amid new COVID-19 lockdowns. While Brent futures for September delivery fell 2.9% to $99.78 a barrel, US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude fell 3.2% to $96.31. This comes a day after Brent fell 9% and WTI fell 8%.

118.title: Vivo Directors escape from India amid ED inquiry against the Chinese firm: Report
118.article_body: Vivo Directors Zhengshen Ou and Zhang Jie have escaped from India as Enforcement Directorate (ED) intensified inquiry into the money laundering case against the Chinese smartphone manufacturing company, said ANI quoting sources. ED on Tuesday conducted raids at 44 locations of Vivo and related firms. The raids were conducted under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

119.title: Jalandhar Police seize 536 passports in illegal immigration racket
119.article_body: The Jalandhar City Police have busted an illegal immigration racket and seized 536 Indian passports. They have arrested four people who were running five unauthorised consultancies and cheated people with promises of sending them abroad. The police also seized cash worth ₹49,000, a laptop and three computers from the possession of the suspects, who are all from Ludhiana.

120.title: US Independence Day parade shooter confesses to carrying out attack
120.article_body: The man charged with killing seven people at an Independence Day parade in the US confessed to the police that he had carried out the mass shooting from a rooftop in suburban Chicago, authorities said. Crimo had appeared in court via a video link on Wednesday. Separately, a police spokesman said that Crimo had "seriously contemplated" carrying out another attack.

121.title: Reduce prices by up to ₹10 within a week: Govt to edible oil firms
121.article_body: The government has directed edible oil manufacturers to cut the MRP of imported cooking oils by up to ₹10 per litre within a week. "Global prices have declined 10% in last one week...This should be passed on to consumers," the government said. It also asked the companies to maintain a uniform MRP of the same brand of oil throughout India.

122.title: Comedian Samay Raina criticised after he tweets joke on abortion
122.article_body: Comedian and YouTuber Samay Raina was criticised after he shared a joke on abortion. "It really takes guts to call yourself a comedian when this is your understanding of...humour," a Twitter user commented. "Even by dark humour standards, this is...crass!" another comment read. "Abortion is not a joke to the ones who [are] going through it," another person commented.

123.title: Nick Kyrgios reaches semi-final of a Grand Slam for the first time ever
123.article_body: World number 40 Nick Kyrgios defeated Cristian Garin in the quarter-final to reach Wimbledon 2022 semi-final. With this, the 27-year-old reached the semi-final of a Grand Slam for the first time. Kyrgios won the quarter-final with a scoreline of 6-4, 6-3, 7-6(7-5). Kyrgios is the first Australian man to reach the singles semi-final at Wimbledon since Lleyton Hewitt in 2005.

124.title: Piyush Goyal urges states to increase sowing of rice
124.article_body: Food Minister Piyush Goyal has urged all states to increase sowing of paddy, saying this season "sowing of rice is 16% lower than the normal level nationally". He clarified there is enough rice stock with the government. However, there is huge demand for rice internationally and the farmers must use this opportunity to export, the minister said.

125.title: S African prez mourns death of teenagers in East London nightclub
125.article_body: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Wednesday mourned the death of 21 teenagers in a nightclub in East London last month. The cause of the deaths is still being investigated. In a public funeral attended by over a thousand people, the president said, "We are losing our future generation to the scourge of underage drinking."

126.title: Rhea's career is ruined for no fault of her, she's not getting roles: Rana
126.article_body: Bengali film producer Rana Sarkar said that actress Rhea Chakraborty's career is being jeopardised for no fault of her. "She went through a lot of trouble and she is also not getting roles in Mumbai," he added. "She has been haunted for being someone’s girlfriend and for being Bengali. I genuinely think she deserves better," he said.

127.title: Fake call centre busted in Kolkata; 10 arrested
127.article_body: Kolkata police have busted a fake call centre in the city's Rajarhat sector, arresting 10 people and seizing incriminating electronic material and documents from them. The accused would cheat people living in foreign countries on the pretext of offering technical support in exchange for money. The accused were booked for fraud, cheating and criminal conspiracy.

128.title: Pune City Police arrest 5 who stole fuel from BPCL tankers
128.article_body: The Pune City Police busted a racket and arrested 5 people who stole petrol and diesel from Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) tankers. The police have booked five others whom they suspected were involved in the racket. The police also seized a BPCL tanker worth ₹80 lakh along with cell phones, cash, three diesel cans and motorcycles from the accused.

129.title: 900 inmates escape Nigerian prison in attack blamed on Boko Haram
129.article_body: Nearly 900 inmates escaped from a prison in Nigeria's Abuja during a suspected Boko Haram attack, officials said on Wednesday. Of these, nearly 440 inmates have been recaptured, while the rest of the inmates are still at large, according to a government spokesperson. The suspected Boko Haram attackers came for members who were held in the prison, an official said.

130.title: City Union Bank to raise up to ₹500 crore via QIP route
130.article_body: City Union Bank on Wednesday announced it is planning to raise up to ₹500 crore through the qualified institutional placement (QIP) route. The private lender added that it has called an annual general meeting (AGM) on August 18 to seek approval for the fund-raising proposal. Last year also it obtained shareholders' approval but did not utilise the same, it added.

131.title: Happy that he has resigned: KJ Alphons on Saji Cherian's resignation
131.article_body: BJP MP KJ Alphons has said that he is happy that Saji Cherian has resigned after the latter resigned from the Kerala Cabinet. "It's [a] shame that the ministers feel they can desecrate the Constitution of India," KJ Alphons said. Saji Cherian resigned on Wednesday amid protests over his remarks on the Constitution.

132.title: Reliance Retail signs long-term deal to bring Gap to India
132.article_body: Reliance Retail on Wednesday said it has signed a long-term deal with Gap Inc to sell the US clothing retailer's brands locally. Under the partnership, Reliance will sell Gap merchandise through a mix of exclusive brand stores, multi-brand outlets and e-commerce platforms. With this deal, the company has become the official retailer for Gap across all channels in India.

133.title: Ghulam Ahmad Mir resigns as Jammu and Kashmir Congress chief
133.article_body: Ghulam Ahmad Mir has resigned as the Jammu and Kashmir Pradesh Congress Committee (JKPCC) President. "It is the tradition in the Congress party that before any reshuffle, the existing office-bearers put in their papers. I have done the same," Mir said. Ghulam Ahmad Mir was the JKPCC chief for over seven years.

134.title: After Maha, BJP will now form govts in Raj, WB: Suvendu Adhikari
134.article_body: After rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde-led new government was formed in Maharashtra, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said, "After Maharashtra, BJP will form governments even in Rajasthan, West Bengal and Telangana where appeasement politics is rampant." His remarks came a day after BJP Tamil Nadu chief K Annamalai said that Tamil Nadu is also waiting for a 'Shinde' to emerge.

135.title: Droupadi ji will represent a new India: Meghalaya CM
135.article_body: Extending support to NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said she will represent a new India. "She represents hope for every tribal, every girl and every woman and will carry with her the aspirations of small communities of India," Sangma tweeted. Droupadi Murmu, who visited Meghalaya, sought support of the lawmakers for the upcoming Presidential elections.

136.title: Extradited drug fugitive returns to Italy to serve 30-yr prison term
136.article_body: Extradited drug lord Rocco Morabito, who was reportedly Italy's second most-wanted fugitive, has returned to the country to serve a 30-year prison term. He was extradited from Brazil and will now serve his sentence for various drug offences. Morabito, who was absconding for almost 28 years, "became the king of cocaine brokers [there]," an Italian official said.

137.title: Ben Stokes doesn't give a damn what anybody else says: Nasser Hussain
137.article_body: Praising England Test skipper Ben Stokes' captaincy, former England captain Nasser Hussain said, "Stokes doesn't give a damn what anybody else says." Hussain added, "He is doing it his way, to the extent of having Stuart Broad padded up as nightwatchman. When did you last see Broad play a defensive shot?" England have won four Test matches in a row.

138.title: BJP wins 102 of 130 panchayat seats unopposed in Arunachal
138.article_body: The BJP has won unopposed 102 of 130 panchayat seats in Arunachal Pradesh where by-polls are scheduled next week, said state Panchayat Minister Bamang Felix. The Congress, National People's Party and Independents have secured another 14 seats unopposed. The by-election to the remaining seats will be held on July 12.

139.title: D2C bakery brand The Baker's Dozen raises $5 million
139.article_body: Direct-to-Consumer bakery brand The Baker's Dozen (TBD) has raised $5 million in its pre-Series A funding round. The funding was a mix of equity and debt led by Fireside Ventures. The company was founded in 2013 by Sneh Jain and his wife Aditi Handa, who is also the Head Baker. TBD has clocked sales of ₹30 crore in FY22.

140.title: Urban Company to grant ₹74 cr restricted stock unit to US employees
140.article_body: Urban Company's board has passed a resolution to grant restricted stock units (RSUs) worth ₹74 crore ($9.5 million) to its US-based employees. The company will draw 2,800 RSUs from its ESOP (employee stock ownership plan) 2015. The Gurugram-based home services marketplace, which was earlier called UrbanClap, has facilitated ESOP sales worth ₹100 crore for its 940 employees till date.

141.title: Bidi factory workers protest for higher wages in Kolkata
141.article_body: Bidi factory workers from across West Bengal protested in Kolkata on Wednesday, demanding a hike in wages, a standard pay structure and medical benefits. "They pay us only ₹116 for binding 1,000 bidis. The munshi (middleman) does nothing for us," said a worker. Centre of Indian Trade Union led the protest demonstrations.

142.title: RBI announces steps to boost forex inflows amid falling rupee
142.article_body: The RBI on Wednesday announced various measures to enhance foreign exchange inflows amid the rupee losing about 6% against the US dollar so far this year. The measures include allowing overseas investors to buy short-term corporate debt and purchase more government securities under the fully accessible route. India's forex reserves have fallen over $40 billion in the last nine months.

143.title: Hold Goa Panchayat polls in 45 days: SC upholds Bombay HC order
143.article_body: The Supreme Court upheld Bombay High Court's order which asked that a notification be issued to hold elections to 186 Panchayats in Goa within the next 45 days. The Goa government filed a plea requesting an extension till September to conduct the polls. The apex court said that it did not find a reason to interfere in the election process.

144.title: Goa govt geared up for e-auctioning of iron ore mining leases: CM
144.article_body: The Goa government is geared up to initiate the process of e-auctioning of iron ore mining leases, CM Pramod Sawant announced. Notably, mining activities had come to a halt in 2018 after the apex court had cancelled the second renewal of 88 mining leases granted in 2015. The government has initiated the process of taking over these leases, he said.

145.title: Centre releases revenue deficit grant of ₹7,183 crore to 14 states
145.article_body: The Finance Ministry on Wednesday released the fourth instalment of Post Devolution Revenue Deficit (PDRD) Grant of ₹7,183.42 crore to 14 states for the current fiscal. With this, the total amount of PDRD grants released to the states in 2022-23 stands at ₹28,733.67 crore. The states will get a total revenue deficit grant of ₹86,201 crore in FY23.

146.title: Used-car startup Kavak to invest $180 mn to expand into 4 more countries
146.article_body: Mexican used-car startup Kavak is planning to invest $180 million to expand into four more countries, namely Colombia, Chile, Peru and Turkey. Kavak offers clients used cars online and through brick-and-mortar hubs. Turkey will be its first location outside Latin America. "The expansion is something the company needs to do, but we're doing it conservatively," CEO Carlos Garcia Ottati said.

147.title: Ex-TikTok gaming head to launch blockchain games startup 'Meta0'
147.article_body: Jason Fung, the former head of TikTok's gaming unit, is set to launch a blockchain games startup called Meta0. The 34-year old said he gave up his "cushy" corporate life at TikTok to offer a "more interoperable" infrastructure option to developers of blockchain games. "Right now, [developers]...have to choose a single blockchain," he said. Fung will act as Meta0's Co-founder.

148.title: SC stays Madras HC order on AIADMK leadership issue
148.article_body: The Supreme Court has stayed the Madras High Court's order which stopped the AIADMK from passing resolutions on the party's single leadership issue. The apex court was responding to a plea filed by former Chief Minister Edappadi Palaniswami. The Supreme Court stay aids the dominant faction within the AIADMK which is pushing for Palaniswami to be the party's top leader.

149.title: I don't think Uddhav-led Sena expects us to return to them: Shinde
149.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Wednesday ruled out the possibility of going back to Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena. CM Shinde said, "I don't think they (Uddhav Thackeray faction) [expect] us to return to them especially after the way they are accusing us." Talking about forming government with BJP in Maharashtra, Shinde said he did not repent for his decision.

150.title: Salesforce to offer $2 mn grant for workforce development in India
150.article_body: Salesforce has announced a $2 million local grant to 22 non-profits across India for education and workforce development. "These grants are expected to impact over 40,000 individuals in India," said Arundhati Bhattacharya, CEO and Chairperson of Salesforce India. Further, as part of another initiative, it plans to plant one million trees in India by 2030.

151.title: 90% of students at JNU are apolitical, 10% are troublemakers: VC
151.article_body: During an interview, Jawaharlal Nehru University Vice Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit on Wednesday claimed that 90% of JNU students are apolitical and only 10% are troublemakers who think they can build their political careers at the varsity. She said that JNU isn't a place for pursuing political aspirations. "You come here to study, you come here to learn," she added.

152.title: 12 cult members charged with murder of 8-yr-old girl in Australia
152.article_body: At least 12 members of a cult were arrested and charged with the murder of an 8-year-old girl who died due to lack of medical treatment in Australia's Toowoomba. The victim, Elizabeth Rose Struhs, who was suffering from type-1 diabetes, was allegedly denied insulin access by the cult. The group believed that Elizabeth would be "healed by god", police said.

153.title: Holiday in Dakshina Kannada educational institutes tomorrow due to rains
153.article_body: The Dakshina Kannada district administration in Karnataka has declared a holiday for all educational institutions on July 7 (Thursday) in the wake of a red alert for rainfall issued in the district. The IMD said that extremely heavy rainfall is likely in Dakshina Kannada, Udupi and Uttara Kannada districts. The rainfall is likely to range above 204.5 mm.

154.title: 1 arrested for supplying poison that killed 9 of family in Sangli
154.article_body: Police have arrested a person from Talegaon Dabhade in Maharashtra for allegedly supplying poison to the prime accused in last month's murder of nine people from the same family in Sangli district. Prime accused Abbas Mohammad Bagwan and his driver Dheeraj Chandrakant Survase were arrested on June 26. Bagwan had reportedly taken a large loan from the victim family.

155.title: Salman's lawyer claims he got death threat letter saying 'enemy's friend is an enemy'
155.article_body: A lawyer representing Salman Khan in a blackbuck poaching case claimed he received a death threat letter from the Lawrence Bishnoi gang. Police have initiated investigation to ascertain authenticity of the threat letter and deployed a policeman with him for his security. The letter allegedly said the lawyer will meet Sidhu Moosewala's fate, adding an "enemy's friend is [an] enemy".

156.title: He has found joy in it: Kevin on brother Nick Jonas embracing fatherhood
156.article_body: Singer Kevin Jonas said he's happy for his younger brother, Nick Jonas who became a father recently. Speaking about Nick embracing fatherhood, Kevin told a news portal, "He has really found so much joy in it. We're just really happy for him." Nick and his wife Priyanka Chopra became parents to daughter Malti Marie Chopra Jonas in January 2022.

157.title: Not every film needs to bring numbers like RRR: 'Modern Love...' director
157.article_body: Modern Love Hyderabad director Nagesh Kukunoor said he's confident that the audience will react positively to storytelling attempts like the Modern Love series. "I...believe there is an audience for everything. That’s how I've managed to survive for 25 years," he added. "Not every film needs to bring...numbers like 'RRR'. There are big films, mid-level films and small ones," he added.

158.title: Happiest moment: Twinkle shares pic of man selling pirated versions of her books
158.article_body: Actor turned author Twinkle Khanna on Wednesday shared a picture of a man who was selling her books' pirated copies. Sharing the picture, Twinkle wrote, "How do you know a book has done well...The real acid test of being...bonafide bestseller though is when pirated versions of your books are sold at traffic lights. This was one of my happiest moments."

159.title: Rajasthan govt to appoint Kanhaiya Lal's 2 sons to state service
159.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday announced that the state Cabinet has decided to appoint the two sons of Kanhaiya Lal, who was beheaded in Udaipur last month, to state service. Gehlot said there is no other source of livelihood in the family of the deceased. He added that with this decision, the family will get financial and mental strength.

160.title: Shiv Sena nominates Rajan Vichare as its chief whip in Lok Sabha
160.article_body: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena has nominated Rajan Vichare as its chief whip in Lok Sabha replacing Bhavana Gawali. She was one of the party MPs to suggest that Shiv Sena ally with the BJP. Earlier in the day, Sena MLA Gulabrao Patil claimed that 12 party MPs would soon join the faction led by CM Eknath Shinde.

161.title: Irani, Scindia assigned additional portfolios after 2 Union Ministers resign
161.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani has been assigned the charge of Ministry of Minority Affairs in addition to her existing portfolio of Women and Child Development after Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi's resignation. Meanwhile, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has been assigned the additional charge of Ministry of Steel charge after Union Minister RCP Singh resigned.

162.title: Crisis-hit Sri Lanka seeks credit support from Russia to import fuel
162.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Wednesday said that he had requested credit support from Russia to help the cash-strapped nation import fuel amid a severe economic crisis. Rajapaksa made the request during a call with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Separately, Sri Lanka plans to hold road shows in five Indian cities to attract more tourists, its Tourism Minister said.

163.title: Avoid non-essential travel to Sri Lanka: New Zealand tells citizens
163.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's ongoing economic crisis, New Zealand on Wednesday issued a travel advisory asking citizens to avoid non-essential travel to the cash-strapped country. The advisory stated that travellers should have contingency plans as they might face a shortage of supplies, including food and fuel. New Zealand citizens residing in Sri Lanka were also asked to avoid protest sites.

164.title: Athlete PT Usha, composer Ilaiyaraaja, 2 others nominated to Rajya Sabha
164.article_body: Former Olympic Track and Field Athlete PT Usha, music composer Ilaiyaraaja, filmmaker Vijayendra Prasad and philanthropist Veerendra Heggade were nominated to Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to congratulate them. "The remarkable PT Usha Ji is an inspiration for every Indian," he wrote for the athlete. "Glad that he has been nominated," he wrote for Ilaiyaraaja.

165.title: Punishing a nuclear power is threat to humanity: Ex-Russia Prez to US
165.article_body: Ex-Russian President Dmitry Medvedev told the US on Wednesday that attempts by the West to punish Russia over its military offensive in Ukraine risked threatening humanity. "Punishing a country that has one of the largest nuclear potentials is absurd," Medvedev added. Notably, Russia and US possess about 90% of the world's nuclear warheads, according to a US-based think tank.

166.title: Pant becomes highest-ranked Indian Test batter, achieves his career-best ranking
166.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant has become the highest-ranked Indian Test batter in the latest rankings. The 24-year-old has moved six places to the fifth position to achieve his highest-ever position in the rankings for Test batters. Team India captain Rohit Sharma, who is ranked ninth, is the second-highest ranked Indian Test batter.

167.title: Man shares pics showing price difference between Zomato online & offline bills
167.article_body: A LinkedIn user has made a comparison of Zomato online and offline food bills of the same order. Rahul Kabra, a Performance Marketing Manager, shared the photos and wrote, "Cost escalation 34.76% per order at INR 178 = (690-512)/512." "Assuming Zomato brings visibility and more orders to the food service provider, should it charge such high price?" he added.

168.title: I've been in constant touch with officials: PM amid Assam floods
168.article_body: Amid the ongoing flood situation in Assam, PM Narendra Modi said, "Assam is facing the challenges of floods. Normal life has been affected. CM Himanta Biswa Sarma and his team are working continuously on relief operations." "I've been in constant touch with...officials and the people in Assam," he added. So far, over 170 people have died in Assam amid floods.

169.title: I want to play a superhero of Indian origin in Avengers: Taapsee Pannu
169.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said she wants to play a superhero. "Please ask Marvel...this is the only wish list I have," she added. "I want to be a part of Avengers, I want to play...superhero of Indian origin. That’s all I'm trying to manifest. So if anyone tells me a way to go about it, I'll follow it," Taapsee said.

170.title: Nigerian arrested with 80 grams of cocaine worth ₹24 lakh in Mumbai
170.article_body: Police said that a 32-year-old Nigerian national, Chukwuma Ogbonna Nwaeke, was arrested with 80 grams of cocaine worth ₹24 lakh by Anti-Narcotics Cell (ANC) of Mumbai crime branch. Nwaeke, who was moving suspiciously in Santacruz area, started running after seeing the police vehicle and was arrested after a chase, an official said, adding he was carrying a bag containing cocaine.

171.title: 4 women who tricked & robbed train passengers arrested in Aurangabad
171.article_body: Four women, who were a part of a notorious gang robbing long-distance railway passengers of their belongings, were arrested by Government Railway Police (GRP) crime branch in Aurangabad on Wednesday. Officers said the women would travel to Mumbai from Aurangabad every two or three days. "They would...board different, random long-distance trains pretending to be travelling alone," police said.

172.title: Ensure constant supply of sanitary pads in schools: HC to Delhi govt
172.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed the Delhi government to ensure a constant supply of sanitary napkins to girl students in government-aided schools under the Kishori Yojana scheme. The Directorate of Education informed the court that an e-tender had been floated for this. School authorities had been given funds to procure sanitary napkins from the government's e-marketplace, DoE said.

173.title: Expecting 4 cr pilgrims to visit U'khand during Kanwar Yatra: CM
173.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Wednesday said the government is expecting as many as four crore pilgrims to visit the state during the upcoming Kanwar Yatra. "We'll ensure a hassle-free journey for all," Dhami said, while speaking at Uttarakhand Startup Conclave and Grand Challenge 2022. "Pilgrims are partaking in the ongoing Char Dham Yatra in record-breaking numbers," he added.

174.title: Elephant birth blocks Kerala-Tamil Nadu road for 1 hour
