"Nadal has always been my idol," added Świątek. Talking about picking between singer Adele and Nadal, Świątek stated on Twitter, "I would need to listen to Rafa singing and see Adele playing tennis."

348.title: TMC should expel Moitra if they don't endorse her remark: BJP's Sukanta
348.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar said that TMC can't detach itself from Mahua Moitra's remark on goddess Kaali. "If TMC actually doesn't endorse it, they should take action and they should either expel her or suspend her from the party for a few days," Majumdar said. On Tuesday, TMC condemned Moitra's "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess" remark.

349.title: Jadeja bowls too flat, India missed a quality spinner: Lloyd on 5th Test
349.article_body: Ex-England cricketer David Lloyd said India were "hamstrung" by not having a quality spinner in the fifth Test against England which they lost by seven wickets, having not picked Ravichandran Ashwin. "[Ravindra Jadeja] tends to bowl too flat and...quick," added Lloyd. "Loop drift and spin bring dividends...Ashwin has it but India played safe-to their cost," he stated.

350.title: US pushes ASML to stop selling chipmaking gear to China: Report
350.article_body: The US is pushing semiconductor manufacturing equipment provider ASML to stop selling any more of its gear to Chinese chipmakers, Bloomberg reported. It's seeking to expand an existing moratorium on advanced chipmaking systems' sales to Chinese firms. "The discussion is not new. No decisions have been made, and we do not want to speculate or comment on rumours," ASML said.

351.title: Canada becomes 1st country to ratify Finland, Sweden's bids to join NATO
351.article_body: Canada became the first country to formally ratify Sweden and Finland's requests to join NATO after member nations signed off on the accession protocols on Tuesday. Parliaments of all 30 NATO members must ratify Finland and Sweden's bids before they can be protected by the NATO defence clause, which states an attack on one ally is an attack against all.

352.title: Instagram Direct down for many users across the globe for over 12 hours
352.article_body: Instagram Direct has been down for many users across the globe for over 12 hours, with users saying they have been unable to send messages. A user took to Twitter and wrote, "Why isn't there any statement on when the issue is going to get resolved?" "It's been 12 hours! How much time it'd need to restore," another user tweeted.

353.title: Important for Team India to have stable captain: Deep Dasgupta
353.article_body: After England levelled the five-match Test series 2-2 with a seven-wicket win over India, former India cricketer Deep Dasgupta said it's important to have a stable captain. "In the last few months...due to injury and other reasons, we had to shuffle between captains," he added. Notably, India captain Rohit Sharma has returned to the squad for England T20Is.

354.title: Biggest proof of honesty: Kejriwal on CAG report showing Delhi govt in profit
354.article_body: Speaking about the CAG report which stated that the Delhi government was running in profit, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that the numbers were the "biggest proof of its honesty". "This honesty has deprived our opponents of their sleep," Kejriwal added. The CAG report indicated that Delhi government's revenue receipts were sufficient to meet the revenue expenditure.

355.title: YSRCP MLA from Nellore enters drain to protest against sewage issues
355.article_body: YSRCP MLA from Nellore, Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy, protested against the officials for not resolving sewage issues in Umma Reddy Gunta by entering into sewage water on Tuesday. He said officials didn't listen to him despite several requests. He demanded the officials to give him in writing, a proper time frame for the work to be completed.

356.title: Hyderabad woman cheated of ₹39 lakh in 'KBC lottery’ fraud
356.article_body: Cyber fraudsters reportedly cheated a woman from Hyderabad of ₹39 lakh. They called her and said she has won 'KBC lottery' and made her pay ₹39 lakh fees as a part of the withdrawal process. When she realised she was cheated, the woman lodged a complaint. Police tracked the accused and arrested a man involved in the fraud from Patna.

357.title: British & their habit of distorting history: Mishra on Barmy Army's 'Eng win series' pic
357.article_body: Veteran leg-spinner Amit Mishra took to Twitter to criticise England's Barmy Army after they posted a picture that read, "England win series 1-0", following the fifth Test at Edgbaston. "Haash! British and their habit of distorting history for their own advantage," Mishra wrote. The series ended 2-2, with India having earlier taken a 2-1 lead after the first four matches.

358.title: US Independence Day parade shooter was dressed as a woman; pic surfaces
358.article_body: The shooter, who killed seven people at an Independence Day parade in US, dressed as a woman so that he could escape the scene of the mass shooting. Robert Crimo was arrested on Monday evening following an eight-hour manhunt and was charged with seven counts of first-degree murder on Tuesday. He was carrying an AR-15-style rifle.

359.title: I'd rather do films I'm proud of, okay if they don't make ₹100 cr: Rajkummar
359.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao said that it is okay if his films do not make ₹100 crore at the box office. "I [would] rather do films I can be proud of and not necessarily something that is working. As long as my producers don't lose money, I can keep telling stories...I don't want to be part of a herd," he added.

360.title: Man electrocuted to death in Kolkata; 3rd such incident in past 2 weeks
360.article_body: A 35-year-old man was electrocuted to death in Kolkata's Tangra area on Tuesday. According to reports, a minor fire broke out at Bunty Haldar's shop at around 9 am. However, when he tried to pull down the shop's iron shutter, he was electrocuted, police said. Notably, this is the third such incident in Kolkata in the past two weeks.

361.title: Bar body urges CJI to reject plea against SC remarks on Nupur
361.article_body: All India Bar Association wrote to CJI NV Ramana asking him to reject a letter petition seeking removal of Supreme Court’s recent remarks against suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. “While engaging with counsel, it is natural for judges to open up and make observations and suggestions,” said AIBA. This comes after several former judges and bureaucrats condemned the court's remarks.

362.title: RBI to release Code of Conduct for digital lending by July-end: Report
362.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India will release the Code of Conduct for digital lending by the end of this month, ET Now reported citing sources. The guidelines will be applicable to all regulated entities including NBFCs and banks. Consumer consent will become mandatory for using data collected from users, the report added.

363.title: We're not doing anything illegal, ours is strong govt: Maha CM Shinde
363.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said, "We are not doing anything illegal." "There are rules, laws and Constitution and we've to work according to them," he added. Furthermore, he said, "Today, we've more than a 2/3rd majority, so our decision is legal." Shinde added, his government has the support of 170 MLAs and it’s a strong government.

364.title: Woman killed in landslide in Shimla, 4 feared washed away after flash flood in Kullu
364.article_body: A landslide on the outskirts of Shimla city left a woman dead and two others critically injured, an official said. At least four people were feared washed away in a flash flood triggered by a cloud burst in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district. Following the cloud burst at Chojh village at around 6 am, four to six people were missing.

365.title: Will not share US user data with China if asked: TikTok
365.article_body: TikTok in response to two US senators seeking an FTC probe into it due to "repeated misrepresentations" over its handling of US data, said, "TikTok has never shared US user data with the Chinese government, nor would we if asked." The senators' request followed a BuzzFeed report saying TikTok engineers and executives in China repeatedly access US users' private data.

366.title: Hyderabad civic body to build more than 35,000 2BHKs by March 2023
366.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to complete the construction of 35,444 2BHKs by March 2023 under the Telangana government's double-bedroom housing scheme. Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao has instructed officials to formulate an action plan within a week for the distribution of the houses. Notably, the construction of 64,556 units has already been completed.

367.title: Mumbai man who abused police for waking him gets 1.7 yrs in jail
367.article_body: A  27-year-old labourer who abused a police constable when woken up at Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus' platform was sentenced to one year and seven months' imprisonment by a sessions court. Refusing to leave the platform, Panvel resident Rameshwar Rathoda abused the police and said, "Does this platform belong to your father...I will sleep here if I want to...Do whatever you want."

368.title: HC dismisses plea over property acquisition filed after delay of 62 yrs
368.article_body: Delhi HC dismissed a plea in connection with acquisition of property in Kalu Sarai after noting it was filed after a delay of 62 years. The plea sought dismissal of notifications of 1959 and 1960 issued under Land Acquisition Act, 1894. "Petitioners accepted...enhanced compensation without reserving any right...the law doesn't permit...to approbate and reprobate at the same time," HC said.

369.title: Suspect in US parade shooting charged with 7 counts of murder
369.article_body: A 21-year-old man accused of opening fire on US Independence Day parade in a Chicago suburb has been charged with seven counts of murder. The first-degree murder charges would be followed by "dozens of more charges", Lake County State Attorney Eric Rinehart said. The accused, who'd reportedly fired 70 rounds into the crowd, planned the attack for weeks, police said.

370.title: PM Modi calls up Tejashwi Yadav to enquire about Lalu Prasad Yadav's health
370.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Tejashwi Yadav to enquire about health of RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who fractured his shoulder after falling off stairs on Sunday. "The PM spoke to Tejashwi Yadav on Tuesday and enquired about the health of the RJD supremo. PM wished speedy recovery to RJD chief," RJD spokesperson (Bihar), said.

371.title: BJP filled with terrorists, it's top 2 afraid of AAP: Kejriwal
371.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal called BJP a party "filled with gundas, hooligans, rapists and terrorists". He noted that a terrorist recently arrested in Jammu and Kashmir was a "senior leader". "If you google 'rapist in BJP', you will find a long list of BJP leaders," he said. He also said that BJP's top two leaders are afraid of AAP.

372.title: Edtech startup AntWalk secures $7.5 million funding in Series A round
372.article_body: Bengaluru-based B2B edtech startup AntWalk has secured $7.5 million funding in a Series A round led by San Francisco-based venture capital firm GSV Ventures. Y Combinator and existing investor Matrix Partners India also participated in the round. The startup, which was founded in 2019, will use the newly-acquired funding to expand its customer base, among other things.

373.title: 5 Assamese-speaking Muslim groups get indigenous status in Assam
373.article_body: Assam cabinet granted indigenous status to five Assamese-speaking Muslim communities. "They are Goria, Moriya, Deshi, Julah and Syed...they will be categorised as Assamese Muslim sub-groups or indigenous Assamese Muslims," state Health Minister Keshab Mahanta said. This will ensure their development in health, education, skill development and women empowerment, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

374.title: Not Bazball, it's what they normally do: Hussain on Root-Bairstow's stand
374.article_body: Talking about the unbeaten 269-run partnership between Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow in England's second innings of the fifth Test against India, ex-England captain Nasser Hussain said, "It's not really Bazball." "The way they...[played] is...what normal Root and Bairstow can do," added Hussain. Root scored an unbeaten 142 with Bairstow remaining unbeaten on 114, as England won by seven wickets.

375.title: India sees 16,159 new COVID-19 cases, 28 deaths; state-wise list of active cases released
375.article_body: India has reported 16,159 new COVID-19 cases and 28 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stands at 1,15,212, with the maximum active cases in Kerala (29,155), followed by Maharashtra (20,820) and Tamil Nadu (16,765). India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,25,270.

376.title: Part of me wanted India to get to 450 to see what we'd do: Stokes
376.article_body: After England recorded their highest-ever successful Test chase (378 runs), England captain Ben Stokes said he wanted India to set a target of 450 runs to see what they would do. "We knew we were always going to go out and try and chase that down," he added. England's Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow scored centuries in the fourth innings.

377.title: Female model from Brazil killed while fighting against Russia in Ukraine
377.article_body: A female model from Brazil, who received sniper training, has been killed while fighting against Russia in Ukraine. Thalita do Valle, who was killed in a Russian missile strike, took part in humanitarian missions around the world and had previously fought against ISIS in Iraq. The 39-year-old's brother described her as a hero.

378.title: England Cricket, Barmy Army troll Kohli after England's record run chase against India
378.article_body: England Cricket and Barmy Army trolled Virat Kohli after England recorded their highest successful Test run chase against India. England Cricket shared a picture of Kohli sledging Jonny Bairstow and a picture of seemingly disappointed Kohli embracing Bairstow after India's defeat. Barmy Army tweeted, "Bairstow has scored more runs in...last 25 days than Kohli has in the last 18 months."

379.title: I train everyday to play matches of this calibre: Jannik after match vs Djokovic
379.article_body: World number 13 Jannik Sinner, who had gone two sets up before losing to Novak Djokovic in their Wimbledon 2022 quarter-final, has said he's happy with his performance in the tournament. "I train every day to play matches of this calibre. I know I still have a lot to improve...[but] I think...I showed a good level of tennis," he stated.

380.title: Fewer judges, absence of infra increasing pendency of cases: CJI
380.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana said that pendency of cases is "intensifying" in India due to absence of adequate infrastructure and sufficient number of judges with the increasing workload. He said that he has been reminding the government to expedite the process of filling up vacancies. "I am hoping for some forward movement in this regard," he added.

381.title: Canada to throw out 1.36 crore AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine doses
381.article_body: Canada will throw out around 1.36 crore doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine that have expired. "Due to limited demand for the vaccine and recipient country challenges with distribution and absorption, they were not accepted," said Health Canada in a statement. The country had procured 2 crore doses from AstraZeneca, but later focused on using Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines.

382.title: Aamir is not Punjabi, could have done better with accent in 'Laal...': Sargun
382.article_body: Actress Sargun Mehta said actor Aamir Khan is not Punjabi and he could have done better with Punjabi accent in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Whatever he has done in the film, it takes a lot to get the results. He has...worked really hard," she said, adding, "If Aamir would have [used] pure Punjabi...nobody could have understood."

383.title: We'll fight for it, protest & go to court: AIMIM leader on renaming of Aurangabad
383.article_body: Days after Maharashtra Cabinet approved renaming of Aurangabad to Sambhaji Nagar, AIMIM leader Imtiaz Jaleel on Tuesday said the residents, whichever religion they may be from, feel connected to the name. "No one wants the name to change. We'll fight for it in any way possible...stage protests, go to court and raise our voice in Parliament," he added.

384.title: TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan granted bail over misleading video on Rahul Gandhi
384.article_body: TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan, who was arrested by Noida Police on Tuesday over misleading clips on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, was released on bail. He was released on bail as the sections against him are bailable offences, police said. Ranjan had purportedly misquoted Gandhi's statements on vandalism at his Wayanad office and linked it to the Udaipur tailor's murder.

385.title: Ajmer Dargah Khadim offers his house to anyone who beheads Nupur Sharma, arrested
385.article_body: Salman Chishti, Khadim of Ajmer Dargah, who announced to give away his house and property in a video to reward anyone who beheads former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma for her comments against the Prophet has been arrested. Police said that Salman Chishti is a history-sheeter and it was found that he made the video in an inebriated state.

386.title: Russia passes bill for stricter fines on foreign tech firms with no office
386.article_body: Russian lawmakers have passed a bill for stricter penalties for foreign internet companies that fail to open an office in Russia, including fines. Last year, Russian communications regulator Roskomnadzor listed 13 companies, mostly based in the US, required to set up offices by the end of the year. Russia has recently acted against several tech firms, including Meta and Twitter.

387.title: BJP supported us for our 'Hindutva position', development agenda: Maha CM
387.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has said that the Shiv Sena MLAs who revolted against Uddhav Thackeray's government had taken a "Hindutva position". Shinde said BJP supported them for their Hindutva and agenda of development. "And they (BJP) supported us despite having more numbers, more MLAs," Shinde told ANI, adding that Devendra Fadnavis became Deputy Chief Minister showing a "big heart".

388.title: Eknath Shinde backstabbed me: Former Maha CM Uddhav Thackeray
388.article_body: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday said Eknath Shinde, who led the rebellion with party MLAs to bring down Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government, backstabbed him. "Shinde to whom I have given the responsibility of the party backstabbed me," Thackeray said. "It's painful to see...those who won due to Sena workers and got everything have left," he added.

389.title: BJP planning to convert Delhi into full UT, scrap polls: Kejriwal
389.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said there are "talks" that the Centre may dissolve Delhi Assembly and convert Delhi into a full Union Territory (UT). "The BJP leaders are now threatening that there will be no next election in Delhi...by making Delhi a full Union Territory (UT)," Kejriwal said. "By hating Kejriwal, you've started hating the country," he added.

390.title: Skills can take you places: Scaler
390.article_body: Edtech startup, Scaler, highlights the importance of building real skills to take a leap in one's tech career. A structured curriculum, taught by industry experts, prepares engineers for tech roles at top companies, said Scaler. Learners get solid career advice on how to create an impact in the tech world, from mentors who've been there, it added.

391.title: UK signs 1st international data sharing deal post Brexit
391.article_body: UK has entered into an agreement with South Korea under which organisations of both the countries will be able to share data across the borders without restrictions, the government said. This is UK's first international data adequacy agreement post Brexit. UK Data Minister Julia Lopez said, "[It] will enable more vital research that can improve the lives of people."

392.title: 15-year-old missing boy found murdered in Pune; 3 minors arrested
392.article_body: A 15-year-old boy was found murdered on Tuesday in Pune, a day after he went missing. As per police, the victim and five other minors had gathered in Moshi for a party on Monday. During the party, they'd heated arguments which allegedly led to the murder. Three minors have been arrested and they've confessed to the killing, the police said.

393.title: Man who said 'Jesus is supreme' gets death sentence for blasphemy in Pak
393.article_body: A Christian mechanic who said, "Jesus is supreme" during an argument with a customer was handed a death sentence in Pakistan. The man, Ashfaq Masih, was booked and arrested in 2017 after he refused to give a discount to the customer for his services. The crowd, which gathered after the argument broke out, accused Masih of disrespecting Prophet Muhammad.

394.title: When will you ask police to issue lookout notice for Mahua?: BJP MLA to Mamata
394.article_body: Following TMC's Mahua Moitra's remark that to her, "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess", BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari asked, "Honourable CM Mamata Banerjee, when will you ask Kolkata Police to issue lookout notice for Mahua Moitra for insulting goddess maa Kaali?" "Why do you and your party leaders reserve all the abusive remarks for Hindu deities?" he asked.

395.title: E-challan helps Mumbai woman find bag she left in autorickshaw
395.article_body: A 61-year-old Mumbai-based woman, who left a bag containing valuables worth ₹5 lakh in an autorickshaw, found it back with help of e-challan. She got off at her destination in hurry due to heavy rain. Realising that she left the bag in autorickshaw she rushed to RCF Police Station where the police detected the vehicle number with help of e-challan.

396.title: Reports claim Dhaakad producer sold office to repay loans, he says 'Absolutely wrong'
396.article_body: Kangana Ranaut-starrer Dhaakad's producer Deepak Mukut has rubbished reports that claimed that he sold his office to repay dues and loans because the film failed at the box office. Mukut clarified, "These are baseless rumours and absolutely wrong. I have already recovered maximum loss and whatever is left will be recovered in the due course."

397.title: Difficult for Vihari, Sarfaraz is waiting: Jaffer on changes in Test squad
397.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has called for Ranji Trophy 2022 top-scorer Sarfaraz Khan's inclusion in India's Test squad in place of Hanuma Vihari, who scored a total of 31 runs in the rescheduled fifth Test against England. "Sarfaraz has been in really good form in the Ranji Trophy and should be given an opportunity," stated Jaffer.

398.title: Domestic LPG cylinder rate increased by ₹50 from today
398.article_body: The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder has been increased by ₹50 with effect from Wednesday, July 6. A domestic LPG cylinder will now cost ₹1,053 in Delhi and ₹1,052.50 in Mumbai. The price of a 5-kg domestic cylinder was also increased by ₹18, however, the price of a 19-kg commercial cylinder was cut by ₹8.50.

399.title: Nadhim Zahawi made UK Finance Minister after Rishi Sunak resigns
399.article_body: Nadhim Zahawi has been appointed as UK Finance Minister after Rishi Sunak resigned from the post. Sunak said that his approach to running the economy was "fundamentally too different" from PM Boris Johnson's. Meanwhile, Steve Barclay has been appointed Health Secretary after resignation of Sajid Javid, who said he had lost confidence in Johnson's ability to govern in national interest.

400.title: Transported to 1947, couldn't believe we recreated Partition: 'Ms..' director
400.article_body: 'Ms Marvel' director Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy said that there were close to 1,000 extras on the set in the scene about the 1947 Partition. "There was a moment when all of us on set couldn't believe that we were able to recreate Partition...For that time we were filming her walking through that platform, we...really were transported into 1947," she added.
